posts.post_content:
I know I'm uninformed, but was crovax always a vampire, that would explain alot.  
but if he had this ability when he was traveling with the weatherlight crew, I wonder what they sacrificed...  
  
oh yeah squee!

Posted By: supershawn (3/7/2011 8:41:42 PM)

posts.post_content:
Combine this guy with kalastria high born and [blood ghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=blood ghast), yes sir.
  
This is possibly the most fitting flavour of a vampire: When he feeds, he grows stronger, when he doesn't feed, he grows weaker, and he can fly when he focuses (or alternately, turns into a bat, flies to the opponent, turns into a vamp, strikes, turns into a bat and flies back). Very nice.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
[Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler) , [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) , [Hero of Bladehold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hero of Bladehold) , [Ant Queen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ant Queen) , [Sprout Swarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sprout Swarm) , and [Death Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Thallid) are all good sources of renewable critters.  
  
Alternatively, you can go old school and just use [Breeding Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Breeding Pit).
posts.html:

Alternatively, you can go old school and just use Breeding Pit.

Posted By: NatalyNeeSama (7/22/2011 12:10:45 PM)

posts.post_content: Crovax wasn't always a vampire. This card is depicting Crovax at the exact moment he killed [Selenia, Dark Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Selenia, Dark Angel) (hence the feathers in the art). At that moment the curse was placed on Crovax to be a vampire for the killing Selenia (see [Death Stroke](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Stroke)).
posts.html:
Crovax wasn't always a vampire. This card is depicting Crovax at the exact moment he killed Selenia, Dark Angel (hence the feathers in the art). At that moment the curse was placed on Crovax to be a vampire for the killing Selenia (see Death Stroke).
